intro: I'm a PhD candidate exploring how Hindu goddess devotion reshapes gender norms in Bangladeshi communities. My work blends devotional poetry, performance, and embodied spirituality through postcolonial and gendered lenses.

academicBackground.title: PhD in South Asian Studies
academicBackground.note: Dissertation: “Redefining Gender Norms through Hindu Goddess Altars in the Bangladeshi Hindu Community.”

researchInterests: Devotional poetry and its aesthetic/emotional power
Gender and religious identity in Bengali culture
Kazi Nazrul Islam’s contributions to religious pluralism
Shyama Sangeet and Goddess Kālī traditions
Embodiment and performativity in spiritual practice
personalTouch: Outside of research, I enjoy collecting devotional music, learning about ritual aesthetics, and building digital tools that support community storytelling. I'm passionate about blending tradition with modern platforms to create new possibilities for cultural memory and expression.
